intro: Reseda luteola var. australis, commonly known as the Australian yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a member of the Pink family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is known for its ecological importance in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
